intro: Tubella gabi-villegasiae, commonly known as the Gabi Villegasia tubeworm, is a species of marine polychaete worm found in deep-sea environments. It belongs to the family Siboglinidae, which includes other deep-sea organisms like the giant tube worm. The plant-like structure of this organism, known as a trophosome, hosts symbiotic bacteria that provide it with nutrients through chemosynthesis. It thrives in hydrothermal vent ecosystems where it utilizes sulfur compounds for energy. This species plays a vital role in the unique ecological balance of deep-sea habitats.
